sentences.sContent: When a gust of wind blows over, the white yarn curl around, the deviation on the street water, stir spray.
sentences.sContent_eng: When a gust of wind blows over, the white yarn curl around, the deviation on the street water, stir spray.
sentences.sCn: 这时一阵风猛刮过来，那白纱袅袅地飘去，雨点斜打在街面的积水上，激起朵朵水花。

sentences.sContent: If one thing could stir his temper or excite his contempt More than another, it was to see a man be fooled by flattery, or elate with popularity.
sentences.sContent_eng: If one thing could stir his temper or excite his contempt More than another, it was to see a man be fooled by flattery, or elate with popularity.
sentences.sCn: 如果说有什么最惹起他的脾气，最能激起他的轻蔑的事情，那就是看到一个人被当成傻瓜大捧特捧，或者因为声望而趾高气扬。

remMethod.val: stir本身是词根， 有“刺激”之意

words.tran: 激动人心的；活跃的，活泼的；忙碌的
搅拌器；搅拌用杓子；煽动者

trans.tranOther: to make someone start doing something
